meanings.definition: Resembling brass in color or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sunset had a brassish glow that painted the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her brassish hair shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The brassish doorknob looked like a tiny sun in the dim room.
meanings.sent4: The brassish leaves rustled in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The brassish sheen of the antique mirror reflected her smiling face.

meanings.sent1: The brassish statue stood proudly in the town square.
meanings.sent2: His brassish attitude made him a natural leader.
meanings.sent3: The brassish voice of the singer filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent4: Her brassish determination carried her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The brassish strength of the bridge held firm against the storm.

meanings.sent1: Her brassish remarks often rubbed people the wrong way.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's brassish humor kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent3: The brassish behavior of the child made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His brassish confidence was both admirable and amusing.
meanings.sent5: The brassish personality of the parrot entertained the guests.
